definitions: warm knitted garment worn on the upper body, typically with long sleeves
examples: She wore a cozy wool sweater against the autumn chill
His grandmother knitted him a colorful sweater for Christmas

definitions: the body's natural process of producing moisture through skin pores to regulate temperature
examples: Excessive sweating during exercise helps cool the body efficiently
The patient's sweating indicated a fever was breaking naturally

definitions: loose, warm garment made of soft cotton fabric worn on the upper body
examples: He wore his university sweatshirt to the casual Friday meeting
The athletic sweatshirt kept her warm during morning jogs

definitions: factory or workshop employing workers at very low wages in poor conditions with long hours
examples: Labor activists protested against sweatshop conditions in textile factories overseas
The investigation revealed sweatshop practices in the garment manufacturing facility

definitions: large round yellow-fleshed root vegetable also known as rutabaga
person from Sweden or of Swedish descent
examples: The soup recipe called for carrots, potatoes, and swede
Mashed swede makes a nutritious side dish for winter meals
The Swede joined our international student exchange program last semester
Many Swedes speak excellent English as their second language

definitions: act of cleaning with a broom or similar tool
wide curved movement covering a large area
thorough search or examination of an area or system
examples: The morning sweep of the shop floor takes thirty minutes
Give the porch a quick sweep before guests arrive
The lighthouse beam made a slow sweep across the harbor
Her hand made a dramatic sweep across the table
Police conducted a sweep of the neighborhood after the incident
The security sweep found several vulnerabilities in the network

definitions: person whose job involves sweeping floors and streets
machine designed to sweep and clean surfaces
soccer player positioned behind the main defensive line
examples: The street sweeper starts work before dawn each morning
Mall sweepers ensure the floors stay clean throughout the day
The mechanical sweeper efficiently cleaned the warehouse floor
They rented a carpet sweeper for the spring cleaning
The sweeper intercepted the ball before it reached the goal
Their sweeper coordinates the entire defensive strategy effectively

definitions: having broad range or effect, comprehensive and far-reaching in extent
the act or process of cleaning with a broom
examples: The government announced sweeping reforms to the education system
Her sweeping generalizations ignored important nuances and exceptions
The daily sweeping of classrooms maintains a healthy learning environment
After sweeping, she mopped the entire kitchen floor thoroughly

definitions: food item with high sugar content or sweet taste
piece of candy or confectionery typically eaten as a treat
examples: The bakery display featured various sweets and pastries
Children should limit sweets to protect their dental health
She offered him a sweet from the candy jar
British children often buy sweets at the corner shop

definitions: substance used to add sweetness to food or drink without using sugar
something offered to make a deal or proposal more attractive
examples: She uses artificial sweetener in her coffee instead of sugar
Natural sweeteners like stevia have become increasingly popular recently
The company added a signing bonus as a sweetener to their job offer
Free delivery served as a sweetener for the subscription deal

definitions: person with whom one has a romantic relationship or deep affection
kind, lovable person often used as a term of endearment
examples: He married his high school sweetheart after college graduation
She received roses from her sweetheart on Valentine's Day
The elderly neighbor is such a sweetheart, always helping others
Thanks for your help, you're an absolute sweetheart today

definitions: enlargement or bulge in something due to internal pressure or expansion
long rolling wave or series of waves in the ocean
examples: The swell in her ankle indicated a possible sprain
Wood shows a noticeable swell when exposed to moisture
Surfers waited patiently for the perfect swell to arrive
The storm created dangerous swells along the coastline yesterday

definitions: abnormal enlargement of a body part caused by fluid accumulation or inflammation
examples: The doctor examined the swelling around her injured knee carefully
Ice packs help reduce swelling after minor injuries occur

definitions: abrupt change in direction, especially to avoid collision or obstacle
examples: The driver's quick swerve avoided hitting the deer completely
His last-minute swerve prevented a serious accident yesterday

definitions: small fast-flying bird with long curved wings that catches insects in flight
examples: Swifts nest in the church tower every summer season
The chimney swift migrates thousands of miles each year

definitions: period of swimming activity for exercise, recreation, or competition
examples: She takes a morning swim in the pool before breakfast
The children enjoyed their swim at the beach yesterday

definitions: person who swims, especially one skilled in swimming or competing
examples: The Olympic swimmer trained six hours daily for competitions
Strong swimmers should still respect dangerous ocean currents

definitions: sport or activity of moving through water using arms and legs
examples: Swimming provides excellent cardiovascular exercise for all ages
She learned swimming at the community center last summer

definitions: garment worn for swimming, typically made of stretchy waterproof material
examples: She bought a new swimsuit for her tropical vacation
The competitive swimsuit reduced drag in the water significantly

definitions: clothing designed for wearing while swimming or at the beach
examples: The store's swimwear collection includes suits for all body types
Designer swimwear often costs significantly more than regular brands

definitions: dishonest scheme or fraud designed to cheat someone out of money or property
examples: The investment swindle cost retirees millions in savings
Police uncovered an elaborate swindle targeting elderly homeowners

definitions: person who uses deception to deprive others of money or possessions
examples: The swindler posed as a charity worker collecting donations
Professional swindlers often target vulnerable and trusting victims

definitions: domestic pigs or related wild animals collectively
despicable or contemptible person viewed with disgust
examples: The farm raised swine for commercial pork production
Wild swine cause significant agricultural damage across many regions
He called his betrayer a treacherous swine in anger
The corrupt official was described as a greedy swine

definitions: seat suspended by ropes or chains for swinging back and forth
rhythmic movement back and forth or from side to side
jazz music style popular in the 1930s and 1940s
examples: Children lined up to use the playground swing
She pushed her daughter higher on the swing
The pendulum's swing marked each passing second precisely
His mood swing from happy to sad worried everyone
The band played swing music at the vintage dance hall
Big band swing dominated American music in the 1940s

definitions: person who participates in partner swapping or alternative lifestyle activities
person or thing that swings or causes swinging motion
examples: The swingers club maintained strict privacy for all members
Some swingers attend lifestyle events to meet like-minded couples
The baseball player was known as a power swinger
The child became an enthusiastic swinger at the playground

definitions: motion of moving rhythmically back and forth while suspended
fashionably lively and exciting lifestyle particularly associated with 1960s
examples: The swinging of the hammock lulled him to sleep
Monkeys' swinging through trees demonstrates remarkable agility
London's swinging sixties scene revolutionized fashion and music
The swinging lifestyle attracted young people seeking excitement

definitions: sweeping stroke or blow with the hand or an object
act of sliding a card through an electronic reader
act of stealing something quickly and casually
examples: The cat's swipe knocked the vase off the table
He took a swipe at the mosquito buzzing nearby
The swipe of her credit card completed the transaction
Employees must swipe their badges to enter the building
The thief's swipe of the wallet went unnoticed initially
Someone made a swipe at the display merchandise

definitions: spiral or twisted pattern visible in liquids, gases, or designs
twisting or spiraling movement especially of liquids or air
examples: The cream created a beautiful swirl in the coffee
Marble cake features chocolate and vanilla swirls throughout
The swirl of autumn leaves danced in the wind
A swirl of dust marked the helicopter's landing spot

definitions: soft rustling or hissing sound made by movement through air
smooth sweeping movement producing a swishing sound
examples: The swish of her silk dress announced her arrival
Basketball fans love the swish of a perfect shot
The horse's tail made a swish to chase away flies
The windshield wipers' swish kept rhythm with the rain

definitions: device for making or breaking electrical connection or selecting options
change or exchange from one thing to another
thin flexible rod or twig used for whipping
examples: She flipped the light switch to illuminate the room
The switch controls power to all connected devices
The team made a tactical switch in their strategy
His switch from medicine to law surprised everyone
The teacher threatened to use a switch for discipline
They cut switches from the willow tree

definitions: knife with a blade that springs out from the handle when a button is pressed
examples: The switchblade was confiscated as an illegal weapon
Many jurisdictions ban carrying switchblades in public places

definitions: telecommunications device for connecting multiple telephone lines
panel with switches and circuits for electrical distribution
examples: The hotel switchboard directed calls to guest rooms
Operators managed the busy switchboard during peak hours
The electrical switchboard controls power throughout the building
Maintenance checked the switchboard for any faulty connections

definitions: person who switches between different options, brands, or allegiances
device that switches between multiple inputs or outputs
examples: Brand switchers often respond to promotional offers and discounts
Political switchers can determine election outcomes in swing states
The video switcher allows seamless transitions between camera feeds
The network switcher manages data flow between connected devices

definitions: act of changing from one thing, system, or state to another
process of directing data or signals between network paths
examples: Switching between tasks reduces overall productivity significantly
The switching of suppliers saved the company thousands annually
Network switching ensures data reaches its intended destination efficiently
Packet switching revolutionized modern telecommunications systems completely

definitions: coupling device between two parts enabling one to revolve without turning the other
examples: The office chair's swivel allows full rotation movement
The TV mount's swivel provides flexible viewing angles

definitions: sudden loss of consciousness from emotional shock or physical weakness
state of ecstasy or rapture from intense emotion
examples: The Victorian lady's swoon required smelling salts for revival
Heat and tight corsets often caused swooning in past centuries
Teenage fans would swoon at the rock star's concerts
She felt a swoon of delight reading the love letter

definitions: swift descending attack or movement, especially by a bird of prey
examples: The eagle's swoop captured the fish from the water
Police made a dramatic swoop on the criminal hideout

definitions: weapon with a long metal blade and handle used for thrusting or striking
examples: The knight drew his sword to defend the castle
Ancient swords are displayed in the museum's armor collection

definitions: large marine fish with a long pointed bill resembling a sword
examples: The swordfish uses its bill to slash through schools of fish
Grilled swordfish steaks are popular in coastal restaurants

definitions: person skilled in fighting with a sword, especially in historical contexts
examples: The legendary swordsman defeated all challengers in duels
Renaissance swordsmen studied complex fighting techniques and strategies

definitions: skill and techniques involved in fighting with a sword effectively
examples: His swordsmanship was renowned throughout the medieval kingdom
Modern fencing preserves traditional European swordsmanship techniques

definitions: large deciduous tree with broad leaves and smooth bark that flakes off in patches
examples: The ancient sycamore provided shade for generations of families
Sycamore trees line the historic avenue leading to town

definitions: unit of pronunciation having one vowel sound forming part or whole of a word
examples: The word 'computer' contains three distinct syllables
Children learn to clap syllables when developing reading skills

definitions: form of logical reasoning consisting of two premises and a conclusion derived from them
examples: The classic syllogism states all men are mortal, Socrates is a man, therefore Socrates is mortal
Students studied syllogisms in their introduction to formal logic

definitions: mythological spirit of the air, typically depicted as graceful
woman or girl of slender, graceful build
examples: Renaissance paintings often depicted sylphs dancing in clouds
The sylph appeared in many romantic poems and stories
The ballet dancer moved like a sylph across the stage
Fashion magazines promoted an unrealistic sylph-like ideal

definitions: spirit or deity living in or associated with woods and forests
examples: Ancient Romans believed sylvans protected their sacred groves
The sylvan appeared in many pastoral poems and paintings

definitions: mark, sign, or word that represents an idea, object, or relationship
examples: The dove serves as a universal symbol of peace
Mathematical symbols simplify complex equations and formulas

definitions: the act or process of representing something through symbols or symbolic meaning
examples: The symbolising of concepts through art enhances cultural understanding
Their symbolising of resistance through colors united the movement

definitions: use of symbols to represent ideas, qualities, or concepts in art or literature
late 19th-century art movement using symbols to express emotions and ideas
examples: The novel's rich symbolism adds layers of meaning
Religious symbolism appears throughout medieval art and architecture
French Symbolism influenced modern poetry and visual arts significantly
The Symbolism movement rejected realism for subjective expression

definitions: artist or writer associated with the Symbolism movement emphasizing symbols and emotions
examples: The symbolist poet used imagery to evoke mysterious moods
French symbolists revolutionized late nineteenth-century artistic expression
